messages.messageBody:
>
><< I've been thinking the same thing myself. I just had my sixth and I'm
>only
>35. How old are you Erin? And what car do you drive? Kimme >>
>
>i am 32, so i could be you in 3 yrs! :) we still fit fine in our windstar
>(seats 7)... tho my eldest daughter said recently, "with the baby after
this
>one (that we are pregnant with!) we'll have to get an astro van." it was
>funny bc it struck me that she is so presumptuous about (what must seem to
>her as) our continual growth in numbers! btw, a chevy astro mini van can
>seat 8.
>erin>>>

Gotta jump in here! I am pregnant with number five (im 34) and we have two
astros
the one has two bench seats and the one with the one bench and two captains
chairs will be a perfect fit! the three older kids are not real fond of the
idea of having to ride together in the back bench, they are pushing for a
bus!!!!
Tanya

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 521
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/22/00 3:59:04 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/22/00 3:59:04 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:

<< I've been thinking the same thing myself. I just had my sixth and I'm
only
35. How old are you Erin? And what car do you drive? Kimme >>

i am 32, so i could be you in 3 yrs! :) we still fit fine in our windstar
(seats 7)... tho my eldest daughter said recently, "with the baby after this
one (that we are pregnant with!) we'll have to get an astro van." it was
funny bc it struck me that she is so presumptuous about (what must seem to
her as) our continual growth in numbers! btw, a chevy astro mini van can
seat 8.
erin
